action.action-desc: Mr. Barrasso (for himself, Mr. Crapo, Mr. Lankford, Mr. Cassidy, Mr. Daines, Mrs. Blackburn, Mr. Ricketts, Mr. Risch, and Ms. Lummis) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to repeal the corporate alternative minimum tax.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Book Minimum Tax Repeal Act.

section.header: Repeal of corporate alternative minimum tax

subsection.text: Section 55 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking There and inserting In the case of a taxpayer other than a corporation, there, and
by striking plus, in the case of an applicable corporation, the tax imposed by section 59A in paragraph (2), and

paragraph.text: by striking subsection (b) and inserting the following:

subparagraph.text: The tentative minimum tax for the taxable year is the sum of—

clause.text: 26 percent of so much of the taxable excess as does not exceed $175,000, plus
28 percent of so much of the taxable excess as exceeds $175,000.

subparagraph.continuation-text: The amount determined under the preceding sentence shall be reduced by the alternative minimum tax foreign tax credit for the taxable year.

subparagraph.text: For purposes of this subsection, the term taxable excess means so much of the alternative minimum taxable income for the taxable year as exceeds the exemption amount.

In the case of a married individual filing a separate return, subparagraph (A) shall be applied by substituting 50 percent of the dollar amount otherwise applicable under clause (i) and clause (ii) thereof. For purposes of the preceding sentence, marital status shall be determined under section 7703.

paragraph.text: The term alternative minimum taxable income means the taxable income of the taxpayer for the taxable year—

subparagraph.text: determined with the adjustments provided in section 56 and section 58, and
increased by the amount of the items of tax preference described in section 57.

paragraph.continuation-text: If a taxpayer is subject to the regular tax, such taxpayer shall be subject to the tax imposed by this section (and, if the regular tax is determined by reference to an amount other than taxable income, such amount shall be treated as the taxable income of such taxpayer for purposes of the preceding sentence).

subsection.text: Section 38(c)(6)(E) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to read as follows:

subparagraph.text: In the case of a corporation, this subsection shall be applied by treating the corporation as having a tentative minimum tax of zero.

paragraph.text: Section 11(d) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking the taxes imposed by subsection (a) and section 55 and inserting the tax imposed by subsection (a).
Section 12 of such Code is amended by striking paragraph (5).
Section 53 of such Code is amended by striking subsection (e).
Part VI of subchapter A of chapter 1 of such Code is amended by striking section 56A (and the item related to such section in the table of sections for such part).
Section 59 of such Code is amended by striking subsections (k) and (l).
Section 860E(a)(4) of such Code is amended by striking section 55(b)(1)(D) and inserting section 55(b)(2).
Section 882(a)(1) of such Code is amended by , 55,.
Section 897(a)(2)(A)(i) of such Code is amended by striking section 55(b)(1)(D) and inserting section 55(b)(2).
Section 6425(c)(1)(A) of such Code is amended by striking clause (ii) and by redesignating clause (iii) as clause (ii).
Section 6655(e)(2) of such Code is amended by striking , adjusted financial statement income (as defined in section 56A) each place it appears in subparagraphs (A)(i) and (B)(i).
Section 6655(g)(1)(A) of such Code is amended by striking clause (ii) and by redesignating clauses (iii) and (iv) as clauses (ii) and (iii), respectively.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2024.
